intro: Rollinia rugulosa, commonly known as the rough-skinned rollinia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Anacardiaceae family, which includes plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are often covered in a rough, textured layer of fine hairs. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellowish drupe that ripens in late summer and is edible when fully mature. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical rainforests.
